content.description: Steep and technical climbing down low leads to an overhung crux. Absolutely stellar movement through the crux makes for a wild finish. This is an outstanding route and would be a classic anywhere.
content.location: Second to the right of the four routes that are all close together.

content.description: A steep and technical start through a small roof leads to good varied climbing above. Sections of thin holds mixed with hero jugs make for a very enjoyable climb.
content.location: Second to the left route, first bolt is low.

content.description: We dreamed of climbing this. Tiny crimps and some overhang with no feet. Looks like a real stinger of a challenge.
content.location: Rightmost route on the wall. Look for the kneehigh bolt off the ground.

content.description: Leftmost route, easiest on the wall. Some fun shallow cracks where you have to apply compression and one bomber pinch. First bolt is nice and low and blank crux is well protected.
content.location: Leftmost route. approach belay pad from right as there is a 10ft drop behind the belayer.

content.description: Down the road a mile from most of the Burnt River Canyon area. The map on the overall area gives a great indication of where it is. Four bolted routes, all relatively short
